message.content:
cs.SE, cs.HC, cs.SI, cs.CY, cs.PL 

Reasoning: The paper discusses system design and its impact on innovation, which falls under the software engineering (cs.SE) sub-category. The concept of extrinsic adaptability is related to human-computer interaction (cs.HC) and social computing (cs.SI) as it involves the ability of users to modify and interact with systems. The paper also touches on the ethical implications of system design, which could fall under the cyber ethics (cs.CY) sub-category. Finally, the paper discusses the concept of hackability, which could be related to programming languages (cs.PL) as it involves the ability to modify and extend code.
